questions.question_text:
You are a system administrator for Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.

All child cases must inherit the product, customer name, case title, and case type from the parent case. Parent cases must not be closed until all child cases are closed.

You need to configure cases.

What should you do?

choices.B: On the case entity, update the Parent case-Child case 1:N relationship field mapping to include all the required fields that should map from the parent case.
choices.D: Validate that customer and case title fields have not been removed as fields that child cases inherit from parent cases. Add product and case type fields to the list. Set the closure preference setting to Don’t allow parent case closure until all child cases are closed.
choices.C: Validate that customer and case title fields have not been removed as fields that child cases inherit from parent cases. Add product and case-type fields to the list. The closure preference setting does not need to be changed. This is default behavior.
choices.A: Set the closure preference setting to Don’t allow parent case closure until all child cases are closed.

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Customer Service. The app is shared by agents and the inventory department. The inventory department manages the products. The agents have read-only access.

Agents must have access to the products to add the products to cases. The agents do not need to view the products in the sitemap.

You need to prevent agents from viewing products in the sitemap while maintaining the ability for the inventory department.

What should you do?

comments.content: Agreed. Checked out that link and it makes sense!

discussion.content:
I would not say D because agents and inventory department share the same app. If you remove the entity from the sitemap, inventory department wouldn't be able to manage products easily (from advanced find yes).

I would say B as per : https://www.inogic.com/blog/2018/08/sitemap-privileges-feature-in-dynamics-365/

Give access to the entity on the sitemap to inventory department who have more than Read privileges to the product entity.

Selected Answer: B
I think its B, now you can edit the app on the make.powerapps and add table privileges on the page settings https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/model-driven-apps/create-site-map-app

By configuring the sitemap subarea privileges, you can control which user roles can see specific subareas within the sitemap. This allows you to hide the products subarea from the agents while still allowing the inventory department to access it.

Therefore, the correct answer is B
